channel.title: Blogs on Explore With Me | A Travel Blog By Satyajeet
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Explore With Me | A Travel Blog By Satyajeet

item.title: Chandipur
item.description: Oh, what a beach! If you haven’t seen this, your idea of beach isn’t complete.

item.title: Chilika
item.description: Chilika Lake is a brackish water lagoon, spread over the Puri, Khurda and Ganjam districts of Odisha state on the east coast of India, at the mouth of the Daya River, flowing into the Bay of Bengal, covering an area of over 1,100 kmÂ².

item.title: Hogenakkal
item.description: Hogenakkal Falls is a waterfall in South India on the Kaveri river on the border between Dharmapuri district of Tamil Nadu and Chamrajnagar district of Karnataka.

item.title: Jagannath Temple
item.description: Puri is famous for the world famous Jagannath Temple & Longest Golden Beach.

item.title: Mahendragiri
item.description: Mahendragiri is the 4th highest peak of Odisha which is situated amongst the Eastern Ghats at an elevation of 1,501 metres in the district of Gajapati in Odisha.

item.title: Mullayanagiri
item.description: Mullayanagiri is the highest peak in Karnataka, India. It is located in the Chandra Dhrona Hill Ranges of the Western Ghats of Chikkamagaluru Taluk.

item.title: Olakana Melana
item.description: Dola Purnima is a popular festival in the coastal districts of Odisha.

item.title: Pyramid Valley
item.description: Pyramid Valley International, a serene valley surrounded by greenery and small hills, is the perfect place for going deep within oneself.

item.title: Raj Ranpur
item.description: Raj-Ranpur is a small town in the district of Nayagarh in the eastern Indian state of Odisha.

item.title: Ratha Yatra
item.description: Ratha Jatra is a Hindu festival associated with Lord Jagannath held at Shri Kshetra Puri Dham in the state of Odisha, India.

item.title: The Sun Temple
item.description: Konark Sun Temple is a 13th-century CE Sun temple at Konark about 35 kilometres northeast from Puri on the coastline of Odisha, India.

item.title: Lepakshi
item.description: The village of Lepakshi is located in the District of Anantapur, about 13 km from Hindupur.
